item.title: ECB steps up aid as economy slides
item.description: The European Central Bank is ramping up its measures to cushion the region against a record economic downturn caused by the lockdowns on business amid the virus outbreak.

item.title: McDonald’s sales drop amid store closures
item.description: Most McDonald's restaurants in the US and China are now open for drive-thru and delivery but global lockdown orders still took a bite out of the company's first-quarter sales.

item.title: Spain’s virus death tally lowest in weeks
item.description: Spain has recorded its lowest daily coronavirus death tally in six weeks but data showing the economy shrank by the widest margin on record in the first three months of the year laid bare the heavy cost of measures to control the outbreak.

item.title: Italian PM warns against lockdown shift
item.description: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte says some Italian regions might be able to roll back coronavirus restrictions more rapidly than others but warned local authorities against acting unilaterally.

item.title: Indonesia’s COVID-19 cases top 10,000
item.description: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Indonesia has exceeded 10,000 for the first time, the country's COVID-19 task force says.

item.title: S.Korea records no local virus infections
item.description: For the first time since February, South Korea has not reported any new local coronavirus infections, health authorities say.

item.title: Japan preparing to extend virus emergency
item.description: Japan is preparing to extend its state of emergency over the novel coronavirus, originally set to end on May 6, for about a month, government sources have told Reuters, even as some other countries begin to reopen after strict lockdowns.

item.title: Nokia profit up but virus dents sales
item.description: Nokia has reported improved first-quarter profit but says the COVID-19 pandemic dented sales by about 200 million euros ($A332 million) due mainly to supply issues associated with disruptions in China.

item.title: Preeminent Aust scientist Lord May dies
item.description: Robert May kept up the fine Australian tradition of ruffling British establishment feathers as he rose to the top echelons of that nation's scientific community.

item.title: Russia virus cases surge past 100,000
item.description: Russia's nationwide tally of confirmed coronavirus cases has surged past the 100,000 mark after a record daily rise in new cases, days after President Vladimir Putin warned the peak of the outbreak was yet to come.
